twist.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to turn a part of your body around or change your position by turning
twist.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He twisted his head slightly, and looked up at her.
She twisted round, so that she could see the dog better.
twist.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if you twist your mouth or features, you smile in an unpleasant way or look angry, disapproving etc
twist.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: His mouth twisted in a humourless smile.
twist.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape
twist.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: She twisted her handkerchief into a knot.
Twist the two ends of the wire together.
twist.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to wind something around or through an object
twist.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: She twisted a silk scarf round her neck.
Ann twisted some daisies through Katherine’s thick brown hair.
twist.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to turn something in a circle using your hand
twist.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Jack twisted the cap off the bottle.
twist.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: if a road, river etc twists, it changes direction in a series of curves
twist.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The road twisted between spectacular mountains.
twist.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to change the true or intended meaning of a statement, especially in order to get some advantage for yourself
twist.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: He’s always trying to twist my words and make me look bad.
twist.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: an unexpected feature or change in a situation or series of events
twist.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: By an amazing twist of fate, we met again in Madrid five years later.
The robbery took a deadly new twist as the robber pulled out a gun.
an unexpected twist in the plot
twist.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: He smiled, a slow cynical twist of his lips.
twist.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a bend in a river or road
twist.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a small piece of something that is twisted into a particular shape
